newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Hong Kong unit trust sales reach 10-month record.
newsitem.headline: Hong Kong unit trust sales reach 10-month record.

text.p: Hong Kong's unit trust industry registered gross sales of US$3.78 billion in the first 10 months this year, the highest year-to-date figure on record, the Hong Kong Investment Funds Association (HKIFA) said on Wednesday.
Net sales also reached a record year-to-date, at US$7.26 billion, more than 11 percent higher than last year.
The international sector attracted the highest net inflows of US$1.64 billion, or 22.68 percent of the industry's net total for the first 10 months of the year, the HKIFA said.
Single Asian country funds and Asia-Pacific regional funds that included Hong Kong but excluded Japan took 22.39 percent and 21.93 percent of the year-to-date net total, respectively.
"Strong sales can probably be attributed to the fact that economic figures indicate that the United States is enjoying a benign, albeit steady growth," said HKIFA chairman Andrew Lo.
But October registered a major drop in gross sales and a net redemption of US$35.33 million.

"The dip is less related to any major change in investment sentiment than to profit-taking. This is most apparent in Hong Kong equities and Asia-Pacific regional funds that invest in Hong Kong," Lo said.
